alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:57PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bell, southwestern Knox and central Whitley Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Faber, or 8 miles north of Williamsburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Permon, Indian Creek, Dishman Springs and Louden around 1210 AM EDT. Swan Lake, King, Clate and Gausdale around 1215 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barbourville, Swanpond, Hubbs, Boone Heights, Bryants Store, Heidrick, Birdseye, Avis, Myrick, Brush Creek, Artemus, Trosper, Baughman, Yeager, Bimble, Kayjay, Wheeler, Flat Lick, Himyar, Old Flat Lick and Ingram. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
